title: Integrate real-time customer screening with vendor-agnostic provider support
summary: Integrate a real-time screening process into the customer onboarding flow, ensuring that the solution supports interchangeable screening providers without vendor lock-in. Provide consistent and timely checks against updated AML and sanctions lists in a modular fashion.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: integrate real-time screening with modular, vendor-neutral provider architecture

title: Ensure screening completes before account activation with <3s per check
summary: Guarantee that all AML and sanctions screening processes are fully completed before activating any customer account. Each check should not exceed three seconds, supporting strong performance and customer experience.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: Must complete screening for all signups under 3 seconds before activation

title: Support switchable screening provider architecture
summary: Design the AML screening system to enable easy switching or addition of external providers, ensuring future adaptability and uninterrupted compliance with regulatory requirements. Abstract provider logic to standardize integration points.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: Architecture must permit switchable AML screening providers

title: Implement fallback flow for screening downtime or latency >5s
summary: Establish an automatic fallback protocol for scenarios where the primary AML screening service is unavailable or response time exceeds five seconds. The process must ensure business continuity and compliance oversight during such periods.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: Fallback flow must activate on provider downtime or latency above 5s

title: Set pending state and notify Compliance on fallback trigger
summary: Upon fallback activation, place customer accounts into a pending status and immediately notify the Compliance team. This ensures oversight during any deviation from the normal screening workflow and mitigates regulatory risk.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: Set to pending and notify Compliance on fallback trigger

title: Log all fallback events and their resolution path
summary: Record every fallback incident related to AML screening processes, including the detailed resolution path and timestamps for audit and compliance. This enables traceability and supports regulatory investigations and process improvements.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: All fallback events and resolutions must be logged for audit/compliance

title: Hold and require manual review for ambiguous or near match results
summary: When AML screening results are ambiguous or close matches, suspend the onboarding process and mandate manual review. This ensures careful human vetting of potential watchlist matches, reducing the risk of onboarding flagged individuals.

title: Audit and record all screening attempts and resolution actions securely
summary: Maintain tamper-evident and privacy-compliant records of all customer screening attempts and resulting actions. This ensures a complete and immutable audit trail to support both regulatory and internal security requirements.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: Audit and securely record all AML screening attempts and actions

title: Provide Compliance dashboard and ad-hoc reporting on screening outcomes
summary: Deliver a dashboard for Compliance to review AML screening outcomes and generate ad-hoc reports as needed. This facilitates rapid oversight, compliance monitoring, and transparency across customer onboarding activities.

title: Display screening status and next steps to users during onboarding
summary: Clearly present the screening status and guidance for next steps to users as they progress through onboarding. This enhances transparency, reduces confusion, and ensures a positive user experience, especially if holds or manual review are triggered.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: Display onboarding screening status and next steps to users

title: Enforce encryption for sensitive data in transit and at rest per regulations
summary: All sensitive data, including audit logs and screening reports, must be encrypted both during transmission and while stored, fully aligning with relevant FinTech regulatory requirements. The encryption protocols must cover data at rest and in transit to protect customer information, comply with compliance mandates, and ensure robust privacy and security postures.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: All sensitive data ... must be encrypted both during transmission and while stored, fully aligning with ... regulatory requirements.
